channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid-19: No change recommended to NI's remaining restrictions
item.description: No significant rule changes anticipated at ministers' first face-to-face meeting in almost a year.

item.title: Northern Ireland's school meals service hit by shortages
item.description: The Education Authority says there has been some disruption to school kitchens' orders.

item.title: Rihanna's NI video for We Found Love remembered 10 years on
item.description: A farmer recalls a "courteous conversation" with the star after asking her to cover up when filming.

item.title: Banbridge: Man injured after 'shotgun attack' on house
item.description: A man wearing a balaclava and carrying what appeared to be a shotgun was seen nearby.

item.title: File on ex-RUC officer sent to prosecutors
item.description: Police watchdog submits file on "potential offences" including murders of three brothers in 1976.

item.title: Coronavirus: Elective surgery hubs planned for winter
item.description: The hubs are to ensure planned operations can continue safely throughout the winter.

item.title: Grammar schools set to run single transfer test from November 2023
item.description: The plans would see the single test introduced for grammar schools from November 2023.

item.title: Translink: Campaign group 'shocked' by request to remove bike lanes
item.description: Bike campaigners say Translink's call to the Department of Infrastructure is "very disappointing".

item.title: Covid-19: Andrew Girvin feared mother would die from virus he gave her
item.description: Andrew Girvin, who was unvaccinated, says he feared his mother would die after he gave her Covid.

item.title: Derry City condemn racist abuse aimed at Junior
item.description: Derry City issue a statement condemning online racist abuse directed at striker Junior Ogedi-Uzokwe during and after the 3-3 draw with Bohemians.

item.title: Edwin Poots wants immigration rules relaxed over farm labour shortage
item.description: Edwin Poots says there are butchers from the Philippines ready to come to ease labour shortages.

item.title: Brexit: Biden in new warning to UK over Northern Ireland
item.description: The US president says he does not want to see anything that could lead to a closed border in Ireland.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records four Covid-linked deaths, 1,060 cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to coronavirus in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,517.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Vaccine misinformation a dilemma for young people'
item.description: NI's mental health champion says it has left young people questioning if Covid jab is safe.

item.title: Teens and over 50s in Northern Ireland to be offered flu jab
item.description: The Department of Health in Northern Ireland is widening the criteria for flu vaccines this year.

item.title: Covid-19: Nisra records slight fall in virus-related deaths
item.description: This week's figure of 61 deaths brings the agency's total number of Covid-19 deaths to 3,307.

item.title: Coronavirus: NI asks for more assistance from military medics
item.description: The MoD is considering a request to send up to 100 armed services medics to Northern Ireland.

item.title: In pictures: The 2021 Balmoral Show
item.description: Thousands flock to the opening day of the biggest event in Northern Ireland's agri-food calendar

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Health and social care tax: Who pays for care homes in NI?
item.description: Boris Johnson has announced an extra tax to fund social care but how is it currently funded?

item.title: NI100: Anglo-Irish Treaty events being held to mark centenary
item.description: The Irish embassy in London is arranging the events to mark 100 years since the treaty was signed.

item.title: Conor Bradley: NI youngster's Liverpool debut hailed by his ex-Dungannon boss
item.description: Conor Bradley becoming the first NI man to play a first-team game for Liverpool since 1954 is hailed by his former Dungannon club.

item.title: 'My husband was given a life sentence with his diagnosis'
item.description: Two women talk about the challenges of getting care for their relatives in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Balmoral Show under way after two-year delay
item.description: Visitors must show proof of full vaccination or a negative Covid test to get into the agricultural event.

item.title: Northern Ireland's first paramedic degree opens at Magee
item.description: More than 600 people applied for 40 places in the Ulster University's new paramedic sciences degree.

item.title: Covid-19: Paul Givan says there needs to be 'balanced decisions'
item.description: Northern Ireland's First Minister Paul Givan says the executive must make "balanced decisions".

item.title: South West College opens £30m campus in County Fermanagh
item.description: The Erne campus in Enniskillen produces more renewable energy than is needed for heat and power.

item.title: Lyra McKee: Two men arrested in connection with journalist's killing
item.description: The men, aged 24 and 29, were detained on Wednesday under the Terrorism Act.

item.title: Portrush Air Show: Cost concerns raised over new event
item.description: An air show has been proposed for September 2022 to mark the Queen's Platinum Jubilee.

item.title: PSNI officers shared 'victim-blaming' rape leaflets in error
item.description: A number of leaflets linking rape with alcohol were distributed to students in Londonderry.

item.title: Northamptonshire project seeks stories of Irish M1 workers
item.description: A writer aims to collect stories from people who came to England to build the motorway.

item.title: Former Irish rugby international Brendan Mullin accused of stealing €578,000
item.description: Brendan Mullin, 57, faces nine counts of theft and five of false accounting.

item.title: People 'spread Covid disinformation' at Letterkenny hospital
item.description: A video shows a patient being encouraged to leave the hospital in one of two incidents in recent days.

item.title: Politicians condemn protest at Leo Varadkar's home
item.description: Protesters gathered outside the home of the tánaiste (Ireland's deputy prime minister) on Sunday.

item.title: Covid-19: 'We want homeworking to stay in Irish life,' says Varadkar
item.description: The Irish deputy prime minister says the option to work from home should continue.
